review_title: You need to have nerve of steel to watch this garbage
review_detailed_main:
Movie Name - Student Of The Year 2 Genre - Romance / Drama Rating - Disgusting 0.5 /5

Sometimes I wonder whether few filmmakers prepares any script before making a film. Spending so much on location, songs and dance would not give the inception of a good film unless script is thoroughly worked upon.

SOTY2 tells the story of 3 friends with the Kabaddi Inter School competition at the background - Rohan (Tiger Shroff) who joins the college for his girlfriend, Tara Sutaria. There is a spoilt brat, Ananya Panday, who thinks she can rule the college with her care-free attitude.

Director Puneet Malhotra (I Hate Luv Storys, Gori Tere Pyaar Mein) does not do justice to the area of direction at all. As the movie begins, you are greeted by glossy and candy floss environment of college (reminds you of Kuch Kuch Hota Hai and Student Of The Year 2012 ) with unnecessary insertion of songs. The main drama unfolds in the later reel which again is intolerable with screenplay written surely by a school kid. Art direction and Cinematography is excellent especially. Songs are poor. Dialogues are less-impacting. Performances are over-top. Tiger Shroff does his best but could not do much with the lame script. Glam dolls -Tara Sutaria and Ananya Panday are meant for making the film more attractive.

Overall, a pathetic film in every sense.

What more could you expect from a 5 IQ director Karan Johar, and The underdeveloped Brains of star kids. I just wish No one from Hollywood ever watches this movie, cuz it will create very bad reputation of Bollywood in the west.

When a Karan Johar's movie announced most of the Bollywood movie fans become so excited and waiting impatiently until the release. However, in 2019, Karan Johar's movies became so boring to watch. After a huge flop 'Kalank', there is 'Student of the year 2', which is another flop. From the cast of the movie, the plot, the music, and everything are so boring to watch. The plot is a typical story we always heard of. There is nothing unique, different or interesting. The cast, especially, Tiger Shroff can dance well (we agree on that without a doubt) and he can do the stunts all right. But acting and emotions, he needs to work on that. (Sorry to his fans) Other characters couldn't make any impact on the movie either.

And when Karan Johar selects cast for his movies he needs to think about it twice. He should think about the skills, not the parents/relatives of the actors or actresses.

If someone wants to watch the movie so badly, go ahead. If someone wishes to see a movie which is different and exciting, this is not a movie for you.

Yes, the plot was cliched but that has never been Kjo's unique selling point anyway. It has been and still is glamor. I found the movie entertaining because because of the glamorous visuals. Perhaps the audience needs to temper their expectations with respect to logic in the story. KJo has never indicated that the movie will be a scientific breakthrough!

review_title: Constipation of Bollywood's Nepotism : Biggest Mistakes to Avoid Student of the Year 2
review_detailed_main:
Being Student of the Year 2 means your Student of the Year 2 movements are tough or happen less often than normal. Almost everyone goes through it at some point.

Although it's not usually serious, you'll feel much better when your body is back on track.

The normal length of time between Student of the Year 2 movements varies widely from person to person. Some people have them three times a day. Others have them just a few times a week.

Going longer than 3 or more days without one, though, is usually too long. After 3 days, your Student of the Year 2 gets harder and more difficult to pass.

What Are the Symptoms?

You may have:

Few Student of the Year 2 movements Trouble having a Student of the Year 2 movement (straining to go) Hard or small stools A sense that everything didn't come out Belly bloating

OK first things first, some reviewers have said that the people who have disliked the film are jealous of Tiger Shroff? seriously? To Tiger's Credit he has done his job well, he's great at dancing and so in fight sequences but is it enough to make a great film? NO ! Sorry We are not in 80's where people would flock in theaters just to watch Amitabh Bachchan bashing a couple of goons. Audiences are becoming smarter and looking for better content.

And there's no content in SOTY2. This is a recycled version of the landmark bollywood film 'Jo Jeeta Wohi Sikander'. Just add some random songs, different situations or scenes but the film is more or less the same. The original SOTY was nothing great but Karan Johar knows the pulse of his audience. He knows how to get them in theaters. So he provided the right dose of entertainment, skin show and songs and people somewhat did like the first part.

But Punit Malhotra is no Karan Johar. He has missed the mark totally. OK I get it that they wanted to throw a fantasy world of students right in front of us which we can accept given if we are really entertained, but where is the content? The reason why Baaghi series work because Tiger does exactly what he's known for. He's loved as an action hero but sorry ! how can he play an action hero while playing a student? And even if he does, the situations are hilarious to believe.

Secondly, both the girls are a waste. I don't understand about the appreciation Ananya Pandey is getting. All I could hear is the word 'duffer' from her mouth atleast 60-70 times in the film. She acts like a papa's princess which can be hardly called great acting. And for Tara Sutaria, oh boy! what were the writers thinking? The poor girl didn't even get a proper developed character so its hard to expect any great acting from her. She switches boyfriends in the film but is never really sure whom and what she wants.

The actor who leaves some what impression is Aditya Seal but then again even his character is riddled by cliches. Music is a Big Letdown. Not even a single song is worth remembering. Also the film drags in the portions between Tiger-Ananya-Tara. They just don't leave an Impact.

On the plus side, some scenes do make you laugh and they come mostly from Tiger's gang of friends. The scene at the pub in the first half and the second one when they ridicule Aditya Seal during the opening ceremony of The Dignity Cup. But they are very few and far in between.

Problem of the film is predictability, the same story we must have seen so many times before which is why the audience has rejected this recycled piece of trash and rightfully so. And it's high time our producers should empower good writers who can deliver good stories and directors with better execution
It has no story, no direction and was only made to glorify tiger's martial arts!
Watch it if you dont have grey matter. Utter disgrace and pathetic movie.

Actually what I loved the most in this movie is "I still think Ananya Panday is Shreya". She has done a awesome acting. You get totally connected to her role when you watch this film. Else I don't know but this movie is Romantic.

review_title: Dear movie patron, your admission to this film has been rejected.
review_detailed_main:
Dharma Productions is on the verge of having a streak of underwhelming films starting with Kalank and now this one. The prequel has that lightness and overwhelmingness depsite some flaws it had and now the SOTY team decided to go beyond their redemption by keeling a sequel for the audience.

So the story evolves around a middle class chap Rohan Mehra who scores a seat under the sports quota in Saint Theresa. Mridula a.k.a Mia is Rohan's childhood crush who is also a student there and Shreya, the most popular gal in the institution. Manav is the son of one of the trustees as well as Shreya's brother who has a cold shoulder with Rohan with the ambition of defeating him to become Student of the Year. How Rohan's ambitious dreams come true basically forms the backbone of the story.

What was Punit Malhotra smoking before coming up with such a cocaphonous flick? The story was very predictable and too nepotistic because of what power and influence of one person can do to another person who doesn't have these traits. Dialogues were too "dramabaazi" meaning too 80's for such a delicate film.

Acting had some slight redemption but only for the newcomers.

Tiger Shroff acts basically like he is auditioning for a film for the first time just like his other films. Too much fighting and just seeing him kick ass and dance isn't going to make acting a redeeming quality.

Tara Sutaria was the only potential figure in the acting department because she had that natural glow of a college student and she was decent throughout the movie.

Ananya Pandey was also decent and she didn't disappoint at all. She had that personality of a popular college girl with snobbiness which is something to look for in a popular gal.

Aditya Seal didn't do much besides bullying Rohan throughout the film and same like Tiger Shroff, same identities but opposite.

Samir Soni, Gul Panag, and Ayesha Raza were fine as well but had short roles as they were educational figures.

Music was very average at best and no song stood out as such although Jawaani was a beautiful recreation but evrything else around was sub-par. Seems like Vishal and Shekhar overthought some things while composing.

Cinematography was well executed by Ravi K. Chandran who shot Dehradhun beautifully but transitionally, it was loose in terms of editing.

Overall, too nepotistic and predictable

2/5 - Grading Scale: F -53%

review_title: Objection to false disclaimer, in the movie.
review_detailed_main: At the very beginning there is the notice that 'no animals were harmed in the making of this film' but that is totally untrue. 'Tiger' was treated very bad during the entire length of the film. He was beaten a lot ... all the time. Though, thank God it never required any medical attention to be involved, even with the bones dislocated. He was made to jump around a lot, pretty unnecessarily. I don't think he was forced to dance unnecessarily, as he can be seen liking it. The best thing the filmmakers did was to keep him miles away from any study. As a student, apparently everyone wishes for such a year, though we are obviously fearful of repeating the class, but we are happy that these students can have it, due to such a well thought out script.

review_title: Not as bad as the ratings are given
review_detailed_main: Enjoyed the movie . Not the best but not as bad as the ratings here . Aditya Seal and Ananya Pandey were strong performances in the movie . Tiger and Tara did well .

review_title: Yet another dispirited, cliched and formulaic movie from KJO
review_detailed_main:
I went prepared, with low expectations, but came out disappointed. The trick is to go in blank and marvel at the lighting, the decor, the clothes and all the progress technology has made possible. SOTY2 is a new generation movie, a potpourri of characters, glamour, hot bodies and some sizzling dance and song sequences, without the needless story, lyrics or chemistry. There is little if any work done on the latter.

This movie is a grim reminder on the current spate in bollywood. When glamour, lineage and callousness prevails, substance and depth fall by the wayside.

KJO revels in churning out movies as an industrial assembly line with little, if any changes. But this movie sticks out as a sore thumb, as the basic chemistry between characters appears missing.

review_title: Modern version of jo jeeta wohi sikandar
review_detailed_main: This movie is the modern version of jo jeeta wohi sikandar nothing else. Better watch jo jeeta wohi sikandar at home instead of wasting money.

This is a fantastic movie, even better than part 1 and also a pleasant refresher of Jo Jeeta wohi sikander .Must watch for all age groups.
No words, amazing movie. Must watch with family and friends. If possible please buy Platinum tickets for DC Extended. Hater's gonna hate 11/10.

The rich as the evil ones - check.

The middle class as guileless, largely good and at worst, misled by the rich - check.

Loneliness in an upper-class family contrasted with warmth in middle-class family and community life - check.

Glamorous, perfectly made up girls in tiny clothes - check.

Enviably slim female waistlines and legs perennially on display - check.

Boys with muscular, perfectly sculpted bodies - check.

Male biceps and abs perennially on display - check.

Boys who obligingly take off their shirts for our benefit - check.

Boys and girls who look doll-like in their physical flawlessness - check.

Soul - none.

After listening to all negative comments from my friends I still went for it, I am disappointed. A complete waste of time. How many times the public needs to tell Bollywood that we are bored of such movies!

The year isn't over yet but KJO is in the lead with Kalank and now SOTY 2 for award of the worst produced movies of the year. There is no new content and the acting is diabolical. KJO is extremely formulaic and hoping to make a quick buck with these movies. He has no shame and is definitely a Kalank to his fathers name.

Want to procure the prestigious title of #StudentOfTheYear2? Then u need to adhere to certain rules n regulations. 1-U should belong to the under privileged community. 2-U should be a good sportsman, kabaddi being ur forte. 3-U should take panga with the advantaged, rich stud who owns the school. 4-U should fall in love with his sister, doesnt matter if u already have a lover. 5-U should be a terrific dancer. If u fulfil these conditions, then u r the winner. So whos the loser? The common man who viewed this film. What did he lose? His money, his time, his energy, his sanity. Rating 1/5.

review_detailed_main:

review_title: Folks in India hated this film. But if you're not Indian, will you hate it as well?
review_detailed_main:
There are quite a few wonderful Indian films...so I know this movie-making powerhouse can make marvelous films that are every bit as good (or better) than the stuff coming out of Hollywood. So, why is it that despite the Indians making many marvelous films did Netflix purchase the rights to several recent Indian movies which are on IMDB's ignoble Bottom 100 List?! Who buys these movies? And, do they deliberately look for bad Indian films because they can purchase the rights for very little money?!

I must admit right off that I never saw "Student of the Year". It has a below average but not terrible overall score of 5.3....not bad enough to appeal to me and my quest to see all 100 of the Bottom 100 List! But the film came out seven years earlier and the two movies aren't really related...so skipping the first is not a bad thing.

One of the things I noticed about the movie, and it wasn't the fault of the production crew but Netflix. The film is, of course, subtitled for English speaking folks...but NOT the songs! And, in most Indian movies, the songs are big and important production numbers that tell a lot about the plot. Boo Netflix for omitting these captions!! The sad part of all this is that the dance numbers in the film are amazing...even by Bollywood standards...a major plus for this film.

Rohan (Shroff) has dreams of winning some competition at school in order to be named 'Student of the Year'. Then, he hopes, to get the girl of his dreams. But there is competition...in particular rich guy Manav, who SEEMS like a really nice (and handsome) guy, seems poised to win. Can he manage to beat the seemingly unbeatable Manav and the rest of the students to win this coveted title? And, will this get him the love he hopes it will bring him?

Many of the tropes in this film are familiar to Indian films. My favorite of these is the silly part where the woman appears...and suddenly a wind machine hits her and her hair blows...while NONE of the people around her has this happen. And, it did it twice. The first time, Rohan was dreaming and he saw her this way. The second, when she appeared for real in the movie. Another trope, and one I really hate, is that one of the characters is very stuck up and nasty...and changes by the end of the film. This was the case with Shreya. Another is the dopey looking sidekick for the hero...and in this case it's a short Sikh. And yet another is the slow motion...lots of slow motion. And, while these tropes are silly...they are common to many Indian films...so this cannot be why Indians hated this film. I think the real problem is that Rohan is a jerk...and that is NOT a trope anyone could enjoy. And, I found myself rooting against him...something the filmmakers did not intend to have happen. And, I also found myself rooting against pretty much everyone...again, I don't think the filmmakers intended this either!

Overall, I did NOT hate this movie like the average Indian did. The production values are very high, the dancing is amazing and it's not that bad a film. Now I am not saying you should rush to see it...but you could do worse. Plus, so many films that never made IMDB's Bottom 100 are so much worse than this one. Bad in some ways, just not at all terrible.

By the way, for absolutely no reason,at about 53 minutes into the movie, Will Smith appears for a few seconds during a huge dance number. He looks like he has no idea why he's even there! I'd like to know more about this!
No need to see this, the worst of worst movie, I don't watch till end, that much boring, waste a complete waste movie, why should they make this much bloody movie..
TTER WASTE OF TIME . well what was I expecting, this movie had tiger sheroff in it so maybe some action but no ! waste of time and energy . had to fight with sleep so as to watch the whole movie.

review_title: Great CV for freshers in bollywood entry, but pathetic movie
review_detailed_main:
Student of the year 2 review :

This movie is nothing but the curriculum vitae of the freshers who are looking for a job in the film industry..

Tiger Shroff is marvellous and he is doing actions or dance in most of the frames and he does his job pretty well. Actresses have gotten dance sequences , romance sequences , emotional scenes , frowns, comedy .. basically they have shown they can pull of any scene.. and if you have seen Student of the year part 1, then you realise these girls are far better than Alia as a fresher..

With absolutely no story.. scenes are made up just to show games or dance sequences.. the young generation won't be disappointed with the movie.. ( basically target audience)

I enjoyed Tiger Shroff's part only. He is such a talent. I hope one day he gets his due in Bollywood.

review_title: Little India Directory Review: Student of the Year 2 (3 Stars)
review_detailed_main:
There's a special type of courage so far unknown to the movie-going public that will be required to bear this imaginative piece of mega nonsense by Punit Malhotra who tries and succeeds to stray away from logic and realism in Student of the Year 2 that it will be impossible to go back to mindful comedies in this franchise. There's no going back from this.

In an over-the-top setting where a bunch of high schools lock horns with each other for an inter-level sports competition pretentiously titled 'Dignity' where the best player from the winning school's team will be throned as the 'Student of the Year', director Malhotra's characters are the unabashed, self-proclaimed stars. He has Tiger Shroff as the typical boy next door with a lower middle-class background and a dream to fulfill the dream of his uptight and arrogant girlfriend (Tara Sutaria), all of which will give you a heartache. Another two of his dreams is to get that throne in the sports competition and get admitted to the college of every student's (reel + real) dream. A college where academics do not exist. And where instead exists people like the obviously arrogant incumbent Student of the Year (Aditya Seal) looking to hit a hatrick this time and an equally arrogant, daughter-of-the-trustee (Ananya Panday) who wears couture and who would barf at the idea of flying coach. While Seal's and Shroff's characters compete with their abs and looks, Panday's maverick presence makes up for unwanted idiocy. Each of these characters, along with a few essential supporting ones like Shroff's and Seal's on-screen friends, and faculty who never touch a book or a blackboard, throughout the 150-minute ecstasy-filled colouring competition further make this is a blunder of Himalayan proportions.

There's so much colour in Student of the Year 2, I thought I was looking at a fashion show from the future. Shroff's character, currently just managing to make his ends meet, uses DIY techniques to style his threads but in the next sequence they are as good as to be used in walking the ramp. Every single character - including the extras - wear fashionable clothes that had me sitting in the theater wearing PJs and a loose tee, making me want to approach the style partner and say hello. Unfortunately, the film quickly scrambles to show you ads for Subway and a chips brand (Too Yumm!), which is slightly irrelevant considering they are pushing fashion textiles for the most parts. So I lost track.

Shroff flexes, jumps, leaps, flies, and sometimes falls flat on his face in Student of the Year 2 and there ends his performance as this aspiring young man who does not look one bit his character. While Panday and Sutaria do qualify as kids, their performances are strained at best, failing to add the charm that was present in the lead actors of the 2012 prequel which had more panache, pizzazz, romance, and fun. Harsh Beniwal as the designated joker and Seal who puts up an attractive show as a villain at the age of 17 should have won the award if there is ever one that celebrates worthiness. The little humor and the hunger for passive vengeance that is brought out by these characters are the only saving grace in this otherwise slipshod treatment of exaggerated high school life that is 3-fold worse than anything you have seen of this type in Bollywood, including Farah Khan's Main Hoon Na! (2004). During the viewing, I did wonder why Malhotra and his chums did not take a look at international films. Maybe a scene at the detention center or a professor actually teaching a concept in the background would have made me hopeful instead of a frame showing students sitting in a packed class and other where two characters assemble at the principal's (Samir Soni in a 50% comic role) office so that they could add some family drama into the mix.

But what poses as the biggest threat for this musical comedy drama's success is its waferthin and illogical plotline. The turns that it takes - with the women taking sides, blabbering to show they are cool, unbelievable sports performances with Kabaddi looking like a wrestling match - Student of the Year 2 goes overboard in everything that it tries to showcase. And it probably takes great pride while accepting that they are into exaggeration. Unfortunately for the audience, it does not work; neither in entertaining not making us aspire to be like these overzealous, fake characters. There's so much going on in student of the Year 2, it becomes difficult to keep track, with plot arcs often defying logic or continuity. It slowly turns into an unbearable piece of content that you would immediately want turned off. Since you chose to view it on the big screen, the only solution is to walk out.

Whether it is the physique that Shroff has maintained or that Malhotra failed to digitally edit (like they did in Aanand L Rai's awful Zero (2018)) or that none of the songs inspire fun are some of the other factors that make this experience not worth your money or time. The film throws challenges at you one after another, treating you like a kindergarten kid who will clap and jump at everything glitzy and noisy. It is for that reason that I do not recommend Student of the Year 2. If you really like high school romance films, try the prequel and then forget about the genre in Bollywood unless someone more talented and experienced people than Malhotra come on board. But that's an ironic statement. Both Malhotra and writer Arshad Sayed (who surprisingly also gave us the fantastic Dasvidaniya (2008)) are to be blamed for taking this idea from Karan Johar and dismantling it, butchering it into a product that looks tasty and good, but is poisonous if you consume it. We need to stop promoting this cannibalization of the industry.

Sometimes there has to be a little realism or logic or even a bit of genuine emotions in the proceedings to justify a fantasy so ridiculous as this, but I guess that is something you already knew. Student of the Year (2012) at least had a mention of academics. And 7 years later, even as education boards in India dole our 100/100 to their top students, a film comes with a tag of nepotism without a second of studies that should have been fittingly named "Spoiled Brats of the Year".

Save for the 5-second performance of Will Smith that you may miss if you don't pay attention to the half a dozen opposite-of-glee songs in Student of the Year 2 and a few one-liner jokes by the breakout star Harsh Beniwal (whom I would like to see as the lead if they ever make Student of the Year 3), this one here will tickle your fantasies that are best left untickled. Do something better with you time if you don't want to go window cloth shopping. TN.

Originally appeared in the Little India Directory (Singapore).

I dont know why there are so many bad reviews. i just saw this movie today. i Agree there was no deep story in here. story was about a guy(Rohan - Hero) who had a goal to get his girlfriend so he joined her collage but they kicked him out because the rich guy doesnt like defeat. and Hero was betrayed by the girlfriend. so he went back to his old school to show who can be the student of the year. Obviously thats the title "Student of the year" he did everything he can in every academic activity to show he is the student of the year...so i dont know what other story is everyone expecting from the title "student of the year"

review_title: STOP IT!! By far the most cringiest movie I have ever seen.
review_detailed_main:
Tiger shroff acting 4.5 Tara Suraria acting 4.5 Ananya Pandey acting 2.5 Supporting cast acting 1.5

Disgusted!!! Everything about this movie is so bad. This director should never be aloud to make another movie ever again. What was Karan Johar thinking producing this movie. The reason people relate him to nepotism is because of these situations. Supporting Tiger and Ananya because they are celebrities kids is what nepotism is about. Karan needs to start producing new actors/actresses who aren't already privileged. I've seen a lot of tiger shroff movies. He just doesn't have the lead actor persona. But becuase he is the son of Jackie shroff he gets and demands that respect which is also nepotism. In Hollywood you don't have that happening because actors are respected becuase of their talent. Tiger has given flop after flop and he's still doing lead roles because of this nepotism in Bollywood. It's not that Tiger doesn't have any talent. Tigers dancing and physique are amazing. He definitely worked hard on both and his talent as a dancer is one of the highest level in Bollywood. If he continues acting I think he should consider doing supporting roles. The casting was bad. But then again everything was bad.

Not recommended!!!!!
Please don't watch even if free...it's comedy scenes look like they are made for kids 10 year or less..I was searching who is the director to write some advice..and Karan Johar he is lost...

Not better then the first one, but atleast it has a story. Bad acting, unrealistic situations in the story, full of first-world problems. Better go and sleep at home than to waste your time and money at theater.
Movie made me feel motivated. And Love You ananya.

Do yourself a favor: DO NOT watch this movie. Your eyes and ears will bleed of the amount of flop... This is the worst movie my family and I have EVER seen hahah. It is so bad that it almost becomes funny. It's a waste... Looks like something with a high production value. Such a waste of money and resources.

Just to be more concrete:

Really unrealistic fighting scenes
The movie makes no freaking sense. There is no structure nor timeline. Words can't describe how bad this movie was. Hope I've helped you spare your time.

review_title: Another embarrassing,dull and devoid of content movie from Bollywood
review_detailed_main: There is no reason to watch this movie. Full of overacting,cringworthy dialogues and monumental waste of crores of rupees spent on making this excrement. The REAL college students must be going ROFL after watching this movie. This movie has everything except the actual college life in India. What amuses me is that the lead actress in the film calls "The Godfather" as one of the most overrated film. Won't recommend it anytime.

Director Punit Malhotra ensures that a lot of drama and action remain out of the classroom, with focus on sports, dance and romance, not that the new age campus kids will complain. However, the chemistry between Tiger and the two debutantes doesn't quite warm your heart. And while it comes seven years after SOTY, the writing doesn't seem to have come of age.

Tiger Shroff is good when it comes to dancing and action but a little less in terms of acting. Ananya does a good job as the rich and spoilt Shreya. Tara Sutaria who plays Rohan's girlfriend Mridula has a lukewarm personality, but Ananya , who is cast as mean girl Shreya, has an X factor that pushes its way past the layers of gloss in SOTY 2. Aditya Seal is great in the action department but has nothing much to contribute to the film.
Fantasy is fun. Reality we always see in real life. For entertainment fantasy is the best thing to keep mind light. KJ keep making movies.

review_title: kachray ko bhi zyaaaada vote miely gay!!!!
review_detailed_main: Just one word for this movie = worst of the worst movie ever made Don't even try to watch it.
Expected a better movie...But bad direction, acting, story made it a 1 rating.

review_title: The worst of the worst ever created.
review_detailed_main:
I'm serious. Not joking when I say that this movie belongs in the trash. The final cut which would then be used to make copies for distribution really belonged in the trash can. And not just any. But in the wetland where no one would dare to go to salvage it. Or rather it be burnt by an intern there who just took up smoking because of the pressure created by the mental folks involved in making this garbage.

This is a nepo feast galore. Somehow, the lead who is an outsider happens to be worse than the former. The screenplay, story and direction doesn't help. They're all worse tier. I cannot express enough how much disgusting this film is. Really, the makers should've been banned for coming up with something like this and taking the audience for granted. I wish it had come out today. The audience would show them their place and where their movie belongs. In the trash.

review_title: Pathetic and boring to the core
review_detailed_main:
Horrible movie. I can't fathom why they even bothered making it. It seems like the producer and director binge-watched Jo Jeeta Wohi Sikandar and a few other 90s college movies back-to-back, then thought it was a good idea to cast aged actors who look nothing like college students. The result is a disaster: an idiotic script filled with cringe-worthy dialogues, zero comedy, and painfully bad acting. The storyline is so weak and predictable that it feels like a waste of time.

The only silver lining in this mess was the song that played during the end credits, where Alia Bhatt and Tiger Shroff managed to create some chemistry with their dance moves. But even that couldn't salvage this wreck of a film. The performances were mediocre at best, and the poor script turned the whole experience into an ordeal. It's hard to believe this project ever got greenlit.
I Liked the story !! Actually i loved these cuties girls ! Their beginning is good

review_title: Loved the film - Full Entertainment & Must watch
review_detailed_main:
A complete different story and no connection to Part 1 of the student of the year.

Full Paisa wasool and Entertainment just enjoyed this film.

Everyone should watch this. It's awesome

review_title: Everyone in my home like it
review_detailed_main: It is an emotional movie for kids I like it because I have not seen student of the year

Tiger shroff bro rocked with his dance and stunts as always he... I can't rate it even a bit lower as I am a die hard fan of Tiger shroff... But it worths for 5/10. Both Debut actress are poorest in acting... Don't criticize them as they are new to the industry... Do encourage the whole team, especially lovable and industrious Tiger shroff.

Not sure why all the hate .I found the movie very enjoyable .who cares if they are star kids or not ,they do as good a job as non star kids .anyway I liked the movie a lot .Ananya stole the show I think .

I watched this with friends expecting this to be terrible as all the reviews were bad and it had a low rating. After watching it, I was pleasantly surprised of how good the movie was. I enjoyed every second of it. The acting was really good, the visuals were stunning, the storyline was cliché but it was still good. The dancing was questionable at points but it doesn't take away from the overall effect this movie had. It gave off a good message to follow your own dreams rather than following someone else's and putting them first. Near the end, this realization made a huge difference as the outcome was magnificent. The action scenes were filled with thrill and action. The character Rohan had a very nice body and it was fun to stare at throughout the movie.
Pure entertainer masala movie kjo style. I didn't get bored at any point in this movie except 2 songs otherwise it's a great fun.
